3180/A0/06/883/001.status_value: No.  No national standards for WASH in schools (including a component on disability) exists. Only gender issues are addressed through separated latrines. The development of the WASH in schools strategy could be a good opportunity to address disability issues. UNICEF will therefore advocate and support the Ministry of water and sanitation and the other concerned Ministries for the development and implementation of the WASH in schools strategy.

3180/A0/06/881/004.indicator_name: Number of children aged 9 months to 14 years vaccinated against measles in Diffa Region
3180/A0/06/881/004.headline: In 2016  Niger faced several emergency situations. Measles outbreaks  with 1 342 cases  demanded the vaccination of 420 928 children. The Rift Valley Fever outbreak (151 cases and 31 deaths) demanded UNICEF support for treatment and Communication. UNICEF also actively supported Government responses to cholera and meningitis outbreaks.
